com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue

Interface YFSCollectionDebitCardUE


  • public interface YFSCollectionDebitCardUE

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      YFSExtnPaymentCollectionOutputStruct collectionDebitCard(YFSEnvironment env, YFSExtnPaymentCollectionInputStruct inStruct)
      The YFSCollectionDebitCardUE user exit provides the option of plugging in custom logic for authorizing and charging debit card related payments.

    • Method Detail

      • collectionDebitCard

        YFSExtnPaymentCollectionOutputStruct collectionDebitCard(YFSEnvironment env,
                                                         YFSExtnPaymentCollectionInputStruct inStruct)
                                                  throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The YFSCollectionDebitCardUE user exit provides the option of plugging in custom logic for authorizing and charging debit card related payments. For additional details, see information under YFSCollectionDebitCardUE user exit.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the methods in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back. The user exit implementation is responsible for timing out and retunring if any calls to an external system fail.


        Pre-conditions: This user exit is called only if the payment type group attribute on the order reads: DEBIT_CARD

        Post-conditions:

        • Payment collection receives a confirmation about the way in which the payment collection has or will be carried out for the order under consideration.
        • If the returned outStruct, YFSExtnPaymentCollectionOutputStruct, returns any of the attributes below, payment collection will use them to set the corresponding attributes on the payment method.
          • If DisplayDebitCardNo is not passed, but the DebitCardNo attribute is passed, it defaults to the last 4 characters of DebitCardNo
          • If DisplayPaymentReference1 is not passed, but the PaymentReference1 attribute is passed, it defaults to the last 4 characters of PaymentReference1
          • PaymentReference1
          • PaymentReference2
          • PaymentReference3
          • SvcNo
        • However, the following errors will be thrown if the proper conditions are not met:
          • OMP11053 - Cannot update payment method when the payment type belongs to the CREDIT_CARD, DEBIT_CARD or CUSTOMER_ACCOUNT payment type groups.
          • OMP11054 - Cannot update payment method when it has multiple charge transaction records.
          • OMP11055 - There already exists a payment method with identical values for these attributes: OrderHeaderKey, PaymentType, CustomerAccountNo, CreditCardType, CreditCardName, CreditCardNo, CreditCardExpDate, PaymentReference1, PaymentReference2, PaymentReference3, SvcNo, DebitCardNo


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inStruct - Required. For more information see, YFSExtnPaymentCollectionInputStruct.


        Returns:
        outStruct For more information see, YFSExtnPaymentCollectionOutputStruct.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.
